recipe.recipe_name: Spinach and Mushroom Egg White Frittata
recipe.ingredients: - egg whites: 8 - fresh spinach: 2 cups - fresh mushrooms (sliced): 1 cup - onion (finely chopped): 1/2 - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - low-fat feta cheese (crumbled): 1/4 cup - fresh basil (chopped): 2 tablespoons - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). 2. Sauté Vegetables: In a non-stick oven-safe skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, sauté for about 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until they are soft. Lastly, add spinach and cook until wilted. 3. Add Egg Whites: In a bowl, whisk together the egg whites and black pepper. Pour the egg whites over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until the edges begin to set. 4. Add Cheese and Basil: Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese and chopped basil over the top of the frittata. 5. Bake: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the frittata is completely set and slightly golden on top. 6. Serve: Let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 8g, Dietary Fiber: 2g, Sodium: 320mg, Saturated Fat: 2g, Total Fat: 5g, Protein: 18g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 400 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Egg Whites: 136 calories for 8 egg whites Fresh Spinach: 14 calories for 2 cups Fresh Mushrooms: 15 calories for 1 cup Onion: 30 calories for 1/2 onion Olive Oil: 120 calories for 1 tablespoon Garlic: 8 calories for 2 cloves Low-fat Feta Cheese: 40 calories for 1/4 cup Fresh Basil: 2 calories for 2 tablespoons Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 2
